com.SIMRacingApps

Class Track

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.SIMRacingApps.Track
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    iRacingTrack

    public class Track
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains information about a track. A track map contains points in percentage that maps to the Latitude and Longitude of the location on the track. This can be used by SIMs that do not output the actual Lat/Long. The JSON files can be found in the @{link com.SIMRacingApps.Tracks} for the different configurations. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_NASCAR_tracks
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jeffrey Gilliam
    Copyright:
    Copyright (C) 2015 - 2022 Jeffrey Gilliam
    License:
    Apache License 2.0

      • _maxPercentage

        public double _maxPercentage()

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Forces a reload of the track's JSON files. Normally the JSON files are only read once and cached.

      • getMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getMap()
        Returns the data map of the track as a Map<String,Object>. The OnTrack and OnPitRoad percentages will be from 0.0 to 100.0 with each one tenth of a percent filled in between. The format of the map is defined in JSON as: 
         {
     "Latitude":    35.351669,        //center to rotate on
     "Longitude":   -80.682891,       //center to rotate on
     "Resolution":  1.9,              //meters per pixed @ 800x480
     "MergePoint":  38.5,             //percentage from finish line where you are safe to merge from pit road to the track
     "MaxPercentage": 100.0,          //Normalize the percentage for distance according to this
     "DistanceUOM": "mile",           //the unit of measure to show distance in
     "TempUOM":     "F",              //the unit of measure to show temperature in
     "SpeedUOM":    "mph",            //the unit of measure to show speed in
     "North":       166.0,            //degrees to rotate map so north points in that direction
     "FinishLine":  270.0,            //degrees to rotate the finish line, post rotation of the map. Initially zero degrees.
     "ONTRACK": {
         "0.0":   { "Latitude": 29.18888888,  "Longitude": -81.072 },
         "0.1":   { "Latitude": 29.18888888,  "Longitude": -81.072 },
         "0.2":   { "Latitude": 29.18888888,  "Longitude": -81.072 },
         "0.3":   { "Latitude": 29.18888888,  "Longitude": -81.072 },
         ...
         "100.0": { "Latitude": 29.18888888,  "Longitude": -81.072 }
     },
     "ONPITROAD": {
         "0.0":   { "Latitude": 29.18888888,  "Longitude": -81.072 },
         "0.1":   { "Latitude": 29.18888888,  "Longitude": -81.072 },
         "0.2":   { "Latitude": 29.18888888,  "Longitude": -81.072 },
         "0.3":   { "Latitude": 29.18888888,  "Longitude": -81.072 },
         ...
         "100.0": { "Latitude": 29.18888888,  "Longitude": -81.072 }
     }
 }
        Returns:
        A Data object containing the JSON file contents of this track defined as a Map<String,Object> in a Data container..

      • _getMergePoint

        public double _getMergePoint(double relativeTo)
        Returns the merging point as a percentage of where you are allowed to merge onto the track after when leaving the pits.

        Some tracks, like Bristol, have multiple merge points because it has 2 pit lanes. So the relativeTo argument should be either your pit stall location or your current location if you are exiting the pits.

        Parameters:
        relativeTo - The point, as a percentage, to use to find the next merge point after. Range 0.0 to 100.0.
        Returns:
        The merge point.

      • getBearing

        public Data getBearing(java.lang.String location,
                       java.lang.Double percentage,
                       java.lang.String UOM)
        Returns the bearing of the requested position based on percentage traveled from the start/finish line. Can return the coordinate based on 2 locations, ONTRACK and ONPITROAD. You can get the bearing at the start/finish line by passing in ONTRACK with a percentage of zero.

        Zero degrees is north, 90 is east, 180 is south and 270 is west.

        If a SIM can return the exact bearing, then it should override this functions and return them. Otherwise, the percentage is used to approximate the position.

        PATH = /Track/Bearing/(LOCATION)/(PERCENTAGE)/(UOM)

        Parameters:
        location - (Optional), The location of where you want the percentage to apply to, ONTRACK, or ONPITROAD. Defaults to ONTRACK.
        percentage - (Optional), The percentage traveled from the start/finish line. Range 0.0 to 100.0. Defaults to 0.0.
        UOM - (optional), The UOM to return the Latitude in. Defaults to degrees.
        Returns:
        The bearing.

      • getBearing

        public Data getBearing(java.lang.String location,
                       java.lang.String percentage,
                       java.lang.String UOM)

      • getFinishLineRotation

        public Data getFinishLineRotation(java.lang.String UOM)
        Returns the degrees to rotate the finish line. Defaults to zero degrees for no rotation. Should be the angle you want to match the already rotated map based on North angle. In other words, it does not rotate with the map.

        PATH = /Track/getFinishLineRotation/(UOM)

        Parameters:
        UOM - (Optional), The unit of measure to return, defaults to "deg".
        Returns:
        The degrees to Rotate in a Data container.

      • getFinishLineRotation

        public Data getFinishLineRotation()

      • getImage

        public Data getImage(java.lang.String type)
        Returns the path to the track image specified by the "type" of image. The image will be located on the classpath. You can also use the this.class.getClassLoader().getResourceAsStream(imagepath) to have Java find the file anywhere in the classpath.

        The supported types are:

        • SAT = Satellite
        • MAp = A Map Drawing

        For example: com/SIMRacingApps/Tracks/charlotte_sat.png

        PATH = /Track/Image/(type)

        Parameters:
        type - The type of image, "sat" or "map". Defaults to "sat".
        Returns:
        The image path in a Data container.

      • getImage

        public Data getImage()

      • getLatitude

        public Data getLatitude(java.lang.String location,
                        java.lang.Double percentage,
                        java.lang.String UOM)
        Returns the Latitude of the requested position based on percentage traveled from the start/finish line. Can return the coordinate based on 3 locations, CENTER, ONTRACK and ONPITROAD. You can get the start/finish line by passing in ONTRACK with a percentage of 100.

        If a SIM can return the exact coordinates, then it should override this functions and return them. Otherwise, the percentage is used to approximate the position.

        PATH = /Track/Latitude/(LOCATION)/(PERCENTAGE)/(UOM)

        Parameters:
        location - (Optional), The location of where you want the percentage to apply to, CENTER, ONTRACK, or ONPITROAD. Defaults to CENTER.
        percentage - (Optional), The percentage traveled from the start/finish line. Range 0.0 to 100.0 or MaxPercentage. Defaults to 0.0.
        UOM - (optional), The UOM to return the Latitude in. Defaults to degrees.
        Returns:
        The Latitude.

      • getLatitude

        public Data getLatitude(java.lang.String location,
                        java.lang.String percentage,
                        java.lang.String UOM)

        public Data getLatitude(java.lang.String location,

        public Data getLatitude(java.lang.String location)

      • getLatitude

        public Data getLatitude()

      • getLength

        public Data getLength(java.lang.String UOM)
        Returns the length of the track using the unit of measure the distance of this track is normally reported in. This is defined in the JSON file. If not defined in the JSON file, then it will default to "mile" in the United States and "km" everywhere else. You can also pass in a UOM as an optional argument.

        PATH = /Track/Length/(UOM)

        Parameters:
        UOM - (Optional), The UOM to return the track length in. Default to track's UOM, which is based on the country it's in.
        Returns:
        The length of the track in a Data container.

      • getLength

        public Data getLength()

      • getLongitude

        public Data getLongitude(java.lang.String location,
                         java.lang.Double percentage,
                         java.lang.String UOM)
        Returns the Longitude of the requested position based on percentage traveled from the start/finish line. Can return the coordinate based on 3 locations, CENTER, ONTRACK and ONPITROAD. You can get the start/finish line by passing in ONTRACK with a percentage of 100.0.

        If a SIM can return the exact coordinates, then it should override this functions and return them. Otherwise, the percentage is used to approximate the position.

        PATH = /Track/Longitude/(LOCATION)/(PERCENTAGE)/(UOM)

        Parameters:
        location - (Optional), The location of where you want the percentage to apply to, CENTER, ONTRACK, or ONPITROAD. Defaults to CENTER.
        percentage - (Optional), The percentage traveled from the start/finish line. Range 0.0 to 100.0 or MaxPercentage. Defaults to 0.0.
        UOM - (optional), The UOM to return the Longitude in. Defaults to degrees.
        Returns:
        The Longitude.

      • getName

        public Data getName()
        Returns the name of the track as reported by the SIM. This should include a specific configuration. Clients should make no assumptions about the format of this name. Use it to display only.

        For example: atlanta_qualoval

        PATH = /Track/Name

        Returns:
        The name of the track in a Data container.

      • getNorth

        public Data getNorth(java.lang.String UOM)
        Returns the degrees of where North points, where zero degrees is at 3 o'clock and rotates clockwise. If North is not defined in the track.json file, then it defaults to 270deg, straight up at 12 o'clock.

        PATH = /Track/North/(UOM)

        Parameters:
        UOM - (Optional), The unit of measure to return the direction of north in, defaults to "deg".
        Returns:
        The degrees to North in a Data container.

      • getNorth

        public Data getNorth()

      • getPath

        public Data getPath(java.lang.String location,
                    java.lang.String UOM)
        Returns the path of the track's configuration. The format follows how SVG defines a path with a Start, MoveTo, End. If needed, there could be more than one segment if it is not continuous.

        The results are returned in the following format. Type values are: -1.0 move to, 0.0 line to. NOTE: I use to use the close Type, but not all Start/Finish lines are at the same place on all tracks. 

         [
     { "Type": -1.0,  "Lat": 0.0, "Lon": 0.0 },
     { "Type":  0.0,  "Lat": 0.0, "Lon": 0.0 },
 ]

        PATH = /Track/Path

        Parameters:
        location - (Optional) The location of the track to return the path to. Can be ONTRACK, ONPITROAD. Defaults to ONTRACK.
        UOM - (Optional) The unit of measure to return the path in, default to the track's UOM.
        Returns:
        The path of the track in a Data container as ArrayList<Map<String,Double>>.

      • getPath

        public Data getPath(java.lang.String location)

        public Data getPath()

      • getPitSpeedLimit

        public Data getPitSpeedLimit(java.lang.String UOM)
        Returns the Pit Speed Limit for this session as reported by the SIM SIMPlugin.

        PATH = /Track/PitSpeedLimit/(UOM)

        Parameters:
        UOM - (Optional) The unit of measure to return the speed limit in, default to the track's UOM.
        Returns:
        The Pit Speed Limit

      • getPitSpeedLimit

        public Data getPitSpeedLimit()

      • getResolution

        public Data getResolution(java.lang.String UOM)
        Returns the resolution to be used with GPS mapping software for displaying the track on a map. The resolution is the meters per pixel based on the standard map size of 800x480. Defaults to 1.9 if the JSON file does not define it.
        Parameters:
        UOM - (Optional) The unit of measure to return the resolution in, defaults to meters.
        Returns:
        The Resolution in a Data container.

      • getResolution

        public Data getResolution()

      • getTemp

        public Data getTemp(java.lang.String UOM)
        Returns the current temperature of the track. The location of this temperature is SIM specific. Should not be used to understand where grip is best on the track. In most cases you will only want to display it.

        PATH = /Track/Temp/(UOM)

        Parameters:
        UOM - (Optional) The unit of measure to convert the temperature in, default to track's UOM.
        Returns:
        The temperature in a Data container.

      • getTemp

        public Data getTemp()

      • getTimeZone

        public Data getTimeZone()
        Returns the time zone of the track's actual location in long format (i.e. America/New_York). The State is set to the short format (i.e. EST). If no track is loaded, it returns the users current time zone.
        Returns:
        The time zone of the track in a Data container.

      • getType

        public Data getType()
        Returns the track's type as defined by Track.Type

        PATH = /Track/Type

        Returns:
        The type in a Data container.

        The fog level in a Data container.

        Returns:
        The relative humidity in a Data container.

        The sky condition in a Data container.

      • getWeatherWindDirection

        public Data getWeatherWindDirection(java.lang.String UOM)
        Returns the wind direction, where East is zero degrees at 3 o'clock. If the UOM is "TEXT", then returns one of the following: N, NE, W, SW, S, SE, E, NE.

        PATH = /Track/WeatherWindDirection/(UOM)

        Parameters:
        UOM - (Optional) The unit of measure to return the wind direction in, defaults to "deg".
        Returns:
        The wind direction in a Data container.

      • getWeatherWindDirection

        public Data getWeatherWindDirection()

      • getWeatherWindSpeed

        public Data getWeatherWindSpeed(java.lang.String UOM)
        Returns the wind speed.

        PATH = /Track/WeatherWindSpeed/(UOM)

        Parameters:
        UOM - (Optional) The unit of measure to return the wind speed in, defaults to track's UOM for Pit Road Speed.
        Returns:
        The wind speed in a Data container.
